meanings.def: a heavy metal object that is attached to a rope or chain and dropped over the side of a ship or boat to keep it in one place
examples: We raised the anchor and set sail.
We weighed anchor (= pulled it out of the water).
at anchor The ship lay at anchor two miles off the rocky coast.

meanings.def: a person or thing that gives somebody a feeling of safety
a person who presents a live radio or television programme and introduces reports by other people; an anchorman or anchorwoman
to let an anchor down from a boat or ship in order to prevent it from moving away
examples: We anchored off the coast of Spain.

meanings.def: to fix something in position so that it cannot move
examples: be anchored Make sure the table is securely anchored.
The crane is securely anchored at two points.
be anchored to something The ropes were anchored to the rocks.

meanings.def: to base something on something else
examples: be anchored (in/to something) Her novels are anchored in everyday experience.

meanings.def: to be the person who introduces reports or reads the news on television or radio
examples: She anchored the evening news for seven years.
